member.name: WS_NAMEDPIPE_SSPI_TRANSPORT_SECURITY_BINDING
member.summary:
The security binding subtype for specifying the use of the Windows Integrated Authentication protocol (such as Kerberos, NTLM or SPNEGO) with the named pipe transport. A specific SSP package may be chosen using the security binding property ; if that property is not specified, SPNEGO is used by default.
This security binding operates at the transport security level and is supported only with the . The NamedPipe/Windows SSPI combination uses the wire form defined by the NegotiateStream protocol and the .Net Message Framing specification.
On the client side, the security identity of the target server is specified using the identity field of the parameter supplied during .
The named pipe binding supports only this one transport security binding and does not support any message security bindings.
